unit_learning_outcomes.description: Competently perform a physiotherapy assessment, including history and physical examination, and interpret the findings within the context of cultural and social factors. (Clinical Practitioner)
Competently apply common clinical tools used in physiotherapy practice to measure impairments, activity limitations and participation restrictions. (Clinical Practitioner)

Explain the rationale for use of selected physiotherapy interventions that incorporates an understanding of the physiological effects and current evidence of efficacy, as well as an individual's impairments, preferences and goals. (Scientist & Scholar)
Work effectively both independently and collaboratively to facilitate skill development in assessment and management. (Professional)

Apply a model of biopsychosocial physiotherapy clinical reasoning based on The World Health Organization’s, International Classification of Functioning, Disability and Health to facilitate physiotherapy assessment and treatment. (Scientist & Scholar)

Describe the key principles and demonstrate skill in selecting and applying appropriate interventions to address different impairments, activity limitations and participation restrictions, including education and manual therapies. (Clinical Practitioner)

Explain the contemporary scientific understanding and epidemiology of pain and other common impairments addressed by physiotherapists, including weakness and loss of range of motion that result from soft-tissue or bony injuries. (Scientist & Scholar)

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: The iLearn site for this unit will provide weekly resources for students, including lecture notes, tutorial worksheets, preparation and consolidation material, videos, discussion forums, and other teaching resources
This unit's iLearn site will provide weekly resources for students, including: lecture notes, tutorial worksheets, preparation and consolidation material, videos, and other teaching resources.

assessments.description: This examination is an integrated examination for PHTY8100, PHTY8101 and PHTY8102. The questions will test your understanding and application of all content delivered in this unit.
You will complete a written interpretation of a case scenario that relates to a patient's pain experience.
You will demonstrate selected practical skills and clinical reasoning based on case scenarios.

The mastery register for PHTY8102 is a list of key skills in which competence is considered to be a requirement for the assurance of quality physiotherapy practice for registration. You must demonstrate a minimum level of competence in these skills as a condition of passing this unit by achieving 60% completion of the mastery register in order to successfully complete the unit.
You will demonstrate selected practical skills and clinical reasoning based on case scenarios.

During the viva exam you will be asked questions about your understanding and application of the fundamental knowledge related to physiotherapy assessment and management that has been covered in this unit.
The quiz will include short-answer questions on unit content delivered up to the end of the week prior to the quiz.
This examination is an integrated examination for PHTY8100, PHTY8101 and PHTY8102. The questions will test your understanding and application of all content delivered in this unit.

In this assignment, you will work in small groups to interpret a case study and create a graphical representation of the factors involved in an individual’s experience of pain. You will also complete an individual written component that identifies and explains the contributing neurobiological mechanisms.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances, North Ryde

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: This unit will provide a theoretical framework and build fundamental skills for physiotherapy practice. You will gain an overview of the scope of physiotherapy as a science and evidenced-based health profession providing high quality person-centred health care within a biopsychosocial framework. You will develop fundamental physiotherapy assessment and evidenced-based management skills through the application of the World Health Organisation's International Classification of Functioning, Disability and Health as a model of clinical reasoning.
data.title: Fundamentals of Physiotherapy Practice

description: This unit will provide a theoretical framework and build fundamental skills for physiotherapy practice. You will gain an overview of the scope of physiotherapy as a science and evidenced-based health profession providing high quality person-centred health care within a biopsychosocial framework. title: Fundamentals of Physiotherapy Practice
